txt.en:
'You are here to help Elladan and Elrohir? I am glad of it, but I would ask you to help me as well, if you have a moment.

'My friend Arrod is a good Elf, but he is not always as cautious as he is well-intentioned, and he often gets into trouble. Master Elrond recommended that he help keep watch over the Trollshaws, and indeed he has been assigned to scout the Bruinen Gorges, but I fear that his mind is not entirely on his duty.

'All of his thoughts dwell on Faimir, an Elf-maiden of our acquaintance in Imladris, and I fear he is not paying the attention he should to his own well-being and safety. Would you seek him out in the Bruinen Gorges and make sure he has not come to harm, [placeholder]? He is sure to have taken up a post overlooking the road.'

'You are from Thorenhad? Elladan and Elrohir entrusted me to scout the Bruinen Gorges for signs of evil, and I am doing so. I have not found much, but I must admit that I hope to find something -- there is an Elf-maid I hope to impress with my valour and my prowess in battle!'

'Please look to Arrod for me, [placeholder]. He is east of here, probably somewhere in the Bruinen Gorges, and though he should be keeping alert for signs of evil and ensuring his own safety, I fear he is likely daydreaming about the Elf-maiden Faimir.'
A Scout among the Bruinen Gorges
'I hope to prove my worth in the eyes of my Elf-maiden!'
Many scouts were dispatched across the Trollshaws to keep watch for signs of evil, and the sons of Elrond want to know if anything has been found.
'It has been quiet. If I were assigned to Nan Tornaeth, I would see some adventure!'

Arrod is keeping watch somewhere among the Bruinen Gorges, south-east of Thorenhad, at a position where he can overlook the road.\n\nNarlinn has asked you to check on Arrod, currently scouting the Bruinen Gorges, though likely more focused on wooing the Elf-maiden Faimir.
